title: 112_hr4373
content: The Act may be cited as the "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" and includes expanded tax benefits for adoption made permanent. The "Making Adoption Affordable Act of 2012" made expansions enacted in 2001 permanent and reinstated expansions enacted in 2010, including an increase in the dollar limitation for adoption credits. The dollar limitation for adoption credits under section 23(a) of the tax code is increased from $10,000 to $13,170 for children with special needs. This adjustment is also reflected in the heading of the section. Additionally, subsection (h) of section 23 is amended to account for inflation adjustments. The tax code is amended to adjust dollar limitations for inflation starting in 2010. Dollar amounts in subsections (a)(3) and (b)(1) will be increased based on the cost-of-living adjustment for the calendar year. Amounts not multiples of $10 will be rounded to the nearest multiple. The tax code is amended to adjust dollar limitations for inflation starting in 2010. Dollar amounts in subsections (b)(2)(A)(i) will be increased based on the cost-of-living adjustment for the calendar year, rounded to the nearest multiple of $10 if necessary. The tax code is amended to adjust dollar limitations for inflation starting in 2010. Dollar amounts in subsections (b)(2)(A)(i) will be increased based on the cost-of-living adjustment for the calendar year, rounded to the nearest multiple of $10 if necessary. In the taxable year, the dollar limitation for adoption assistance programs is amended to $13,170 from $10,000. The tax code is amended to adjust dollar limitations for inflation starting in 2010. The exclusion for adoption of a child with special needs is increased from $10,000 to $13,170. The tax code is amended to adjust dollar limitations for inflation starting in 2010. Subsection (f) of section 137 of the tax code is amended to include adjustments for inflation by increasing dollar amounts in subsections (a)(2) and (b)(1) based on the cost-of-living adjustment determined for the calendar year. The tax code is amended to adjust dollar limitations for inflation starting in 2010. Dollar amounts in subsection (b)(2)(A) will be increased by the cost-of-living adjustment for the calendar year, rounded to the nearest multiple of $10 if necessary. The tax code is amended to adjust dollar limitations for inflation starting in 2010, with amounts rounded to the nearest multiple of $10 if necessary. Section 23 is redesignated as section 36C and moved to a new location in the Internal Revenue Code. The tax code is amended to adjust dollar limitations for inflation starting in 2010, with amounts rounded to the nearest multiple of $10 if necessary. Section 36C is moved to a new location in the Internal Revenue Code, with conforming amendments made to sections 24, 25, 25A, and 25B. The tax code is amended to adjust dollar limitations for inflation starting in 2010, with amounts rounded to the nearest multiple of $10 if necessary. Sections 25A, 25B, 26, 30, and 30B are amended by striking specific references to section 23. Section 36C is relocated within the Internal Revenue Code with corresponding adjustments to sections 24, 25, 25A, and 25B. Section 30D(c)(2)(B)(ii) of the tax code is amended by removing references to section 23 and making adjustments. Section 36C is amended by removing paragraph (4) of subsection (b) and subsection (c). Section 137 is amended by replacing references to section 23 with section 36C in subsections (d) and (e). Section 36C is amended in various subsections by replacing references to section 23 with section 36C. Amendments include changes in sections 904(i), 1016(a)(26), 1400C(d), and 6211(b)(4)(A) of the tax code. Section 36C is amended in various subsections by replacing references to section 23 with section 36C. This includes changes in the table of sections for subpart A and C of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendments made to section 36C include coordination with sunset provisions and have an effective date for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2011.
